description:
BundleDeployment is used internally by Fleet and should not be used directly.
When a Bundle is deployed to a cluster an instance of a Bundle is called a
BundleDeployment. A BundleDeployment represents the state of that Bundle on
a specific cluster with its cluster-specific customizations. The Fleet agent
is only aware of BundleDeployment resources that are created for the cluster
the agent is managing.

apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description: Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents. Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to. Cannot be updated. In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

correctDrift.description: CorrectDrift specifies how drift correction should work.

force.description: Force helm rollback with --force option will be used if true. This will try to recreate all resources in the release.

keepFailHistory.description: KeepFailHistory keeps track of failed rollbacks in the helm history.

dependsOn.description: DependsOn refers to the bundles which must be ready before this bundle can be deployed.

matchExpressions.description: matchExpressions is a list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.

items.description:
A label selector requirement is a selector that contains values, a key, and an operator that
relates the key and values.

key.description: key is the label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description:
operator represents a key's relationship to a set of values.
Valid operators are In, NotIn, Exists and DoesNotExist.

values.description:
values is an array of string values. If the operator is In or NotIn,
the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is Exists or DoesNotExist,
the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic
merge patch.

matchLabels.description:
matchLabels is a map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels
map is equivalent to an element of matchExpressions, whose key field is "key", the
operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.

deploymentID.description: DeploymentID is the ID of the currently applied deployment.

helmChartOptions.description:
HelmChartOptions is not nil and has the helm chart config details when contents
should be downloaded from a helm chart

helmAppInsecureSkipTLSVerify.description: InsecureSkipTLSverify will use insecure HTTPS to clone the helm app resource.

helmAppSecretName.description:
SecretName stores the secret name for storing credentials when accessing
a remote helm repository defined in a HelmApp resource

ociContents.description: OCIContents is true when this deployment's contents is stored in an oci registry

options.description: Options are the deployment options, that are currently applied.

correctDrift.description: CorrectDrift specifies how drift correction should work.

force.description: Force helm rollback with --force option will be used if true. This will try to recreate all resources in the release.

keepFailHistory.description: KeepFailHistory keeps track of failed rollbacks in the helm history.

defaultNamespace.description:
DefaultNamespace is the namespace to use for resources that do not
specify a namespace. This field is not used to enforce or lock down
the deployment to a specific namespace.

deleteCRDResources.description: DeleteCRDResources deletes CRDs. Warning! this will also delete all your Custom Resources.

deleteNamespace.description: DeleteNamespace can be used to delete the deployed namespace when removing the bundle

diff.description: Diff can be used to ignore the modified state of objects which are amended at runtime.

comparePatches.description: ComparePatches match a resource and remove fields from the check for modifications.

items.description: ComparePatch matches a resource and removes fields from the check for modifications.

apiVersion.description: APIVersion is the apiVersion of the resource to match.

jsonPointers.description: JSONPointers ignore diffs at a certain JSON path.

kind.description: Kind is the kind of the resource to match.

name.description: Name is the name of the resource to match.

namespace.description: Namespace is the namespace of the resource to match.

operations.description: Operations remove a JSON path from the resource.

path.description: Path is the JSON path to remove.

forceSyncGeneration.description: ForceSyncGeneration is used to force a redeployment

helm.description: Helm options for the deployment, like the chart name, repo and values.

atomic.description: Atomic sets the --atomic flag when Helm is performing an upgrade

chart.description:
Chart can refer to any go-getter URL or OCI registry based helm
chart URL. The chart will be downloaded.

disableDNS.description: DisableDNS can be used to customize Helm's EnableDNS option, which Fleet sets to `true` by default.

disableDependencyUpdate.description: DisableDependencyUpdate allows skipping chart dependencies update

disablePreProcess.description: DisablePreProcess disables template processing in values

force.description: Force allows to override immutable resources. This could be dangerous.

maxHistory.description: MaxHistory limits the maximum number of revisions saved per release by Helm.

releaseName.description:
ReleaseName sets a custom release name to deploy the chart as. If
not specified a release name will be generated by combining the
invoking GitRepo.name + GitRepo.path.

repo.description: Repo is the name of the HTTPS helm repo to download the chart from.

skipSchemaValidation.description: SkipSchemaValidation allows skipping schema validation against the chart values

takeOwnership.description: TakeOwnership makes helm skip the check for its own annotations

timeoutSeconds.description: TimeoutSeconds is the time to wait for Helm operations.

values.description:
Values passed to Helm. It is possible to specify the keys and values
as go template strings.

valuesFiles.description: ValuesFiles is a list of files to load values from.

valuesFrom.description: ValuesFrom loads the values from configmaps and secrets.

items.description: Define helm values that can come from configmap, secret or external. Credit: https://github.com/fluxcd/helm-operator/blob/0cfea875b5d44bea995abe7324819432070dfbdc/pkg/apis/helm.fluxcd.io/v1/types_helmrelease.go#L439

configMapKeyRef.description: The reference to a config map with release values.

name.description: Name of a resource in the same namespace as the referent.

secretKeyRef.description: The reference to a secret with release values.

name.description: Name of a resource in the same namespace as the referent.

version.description: Version of the chart to download

waitForJobs.description:
WaitForJobs if set and timeoutSeconds provided, will wait until all
Jobs have been completed before marking the GitRepo as ready. It
will wait for as long as timeoutSeconds

ignore.description: IgnoreOptions can be used to ignore fields when monitoring the bundle.

conditions.description: Conditions is a list of conditions to be ignored when monitoring the Bundle.

keepResources.description: KeepResources can be used to keep the deployed resources when removing the bundle

kustomize.description:
Kustomize options for the deployment, like the dir containing the
kustomization.yaml file.

dir.description:
Dir points to a custom folder for kustomize resources. This folder must contain
a kustomization.yaml file.

namespace.description:
TargetNamespace if present will assign all resource to this
namespace and if any cluster scoped resource exists the deployment
will fail.

namespaceAnnotations.description: NamespaceAnnotations are annotations that will be appended to the namespace created by Fleet.

namespaceLabels.description: NamespaceLabels are labels that will be appended to the namespace created by Fleet.

serviceAccount.description: ServiceAccount which will be used to perform this deployment.

yaml.description:
YAML options, if using raw YAML these are names that map to
overlays/{name} files that will be used to replace or patch a resource.

overlays.description:
Overlays is a list of names that maps to folders in "overlays/".
If you wish to customize the file ./subdir/resource.yaml then a file
./overlays/myoverlay/subdir/resource.yaml will replace the base
file.
A file named ./overlays/myoverlay/subdir/resource_patch.yaml will patch the base file.

paused.description:
Paused if set to true, will stop any BundleDeployments from being
updated. If true, BundleDeployments will be marked as out of sync
when changes are detected.

stagedDeploymentID.description: StagedDeploymentID is the ID of the staged deployment.

stagedOptions.description:
StagedOptions are the deployment options, that are staged for
the next deployment.

correctDrift.description: CorrectDrift specifies how drift correction should work.

force.description: Force helm rollback with --force option will be used if true. This will try to recreate all resources in the release.

keepFailHistory.description: KeepFailHistory keeps track of failed rollbacks in the helm history.

defaultNamespace.description:
DefaultNamespace is the namespace to use for resources that do not
specify a namespace. This field is not used to enforce or lock down
the deployment to a specific namespace.

deleteCRDResources.description: DeleteCRDResources deletes CRDs. Warning! this will also delete all your Custom Resources.

deleteNamespace.description: DeleteNamespace can be used to delete the deployed namespace when removing the bundle

diff.description: Diff can be used to ignore the modified state of objects which are amended at runtime.

comparePatches.description: ComparePatches match a resource and remove fields from the check for modifications.

items.description: ComparePatch matches a resource and removes fields from the check for modifications.

apiVersion.description: APIVersion is the apiVersion of the resource to match.

jsonPointers.description: JSONPointers ignore diffs at a certain JSON path.

name.description: Name is the name of the resource to match.

namespace.description: Namespace is the namespace of the resource to match.

operations.description: Operations remove a JSON path from the resource.

path.description: Path is the JSON path to remove.

forceSyncGeneration.description: ForceSyncGeneration is used to force a redeployment

Dir points to a custom folder for kustomize resources. This folder must contain

lastTransitionTime.description: Last time the condition transitioned from one status to another.

lastUpdateTime.description: The last time this condition was updated.

message.description: Human-readable message indicating details about last transition

reason.description: The reason for the condition's last transition.

status.description: Status of the condition, one of True, False, Unknown.

items.description:
ModifiedStatus is used to report the status of a resource that is modified.
It indicates if the modification was a create, a delete or a patch.

exist.description: Exist is true if the resource exists but is not owned by us. This can happen if a resource was adopted by another bundle whereas the first bundle still exists and due to that reports that it does not own it.

items.description: NonReadyStatus is used to report the status of a resource that is not ready. It includes a summary.

uid.description:
UID is a type that holds unique ID values, including UUIDs.  Because we
don't ONLY use UUIDs, this is an alias to string.  Being a type captures
intent and helps make sure that UIDs and names do not get conflated.

release.description: Release is the Helm release ID

resources.description:
Resources lists the metadata of resources that were deployed
according to the helm release history.

items.description: BundleDeploymentResource contains the metadata of a deployed resource.
